item.title: Purpose
item.description: In an age where it’s clear Meaning is not something you stumble across, like the answer to a riddle or the prize in a treasure hunt. Meaning is something you build into your life.

item.title: Work
item.description: The Generalist Disease by Dan Hock “Generalism is not the goal. It is just a means of goal-seeking to find what it is you really want to do. Ultimately you must specialize to build real leverage, which requires the exact opposite of increasing optionality.

item.title: Writing
item.description: Why write? § More People Should Write by James Somers Writes and Write-Nots by Paul Graham My 12 Favorite Problems by Ted Gioia These pieces are about more than just writing — they’re about the importance of being preoccupied with a question.

item.title: about
item.description: “The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think” — Edwin Schlossberg Thesis § As you peruse, you’ll notice that this isn’t your average blog.
